@amyhoy @stevesi @emollick I'm no whale expert or anything but it's exciting to me to take hours of whalesong; turn it into embeddings; explore the groupings of those embeddings; find the centroids, and then play "ur-songs" back to some whale buddies, and ya know, see what they do- that all makes sense

@amyhoy @stevesi @emollick I don't want to be pedantic- but it's not the same thing, it is the inverse of it; you are saying "the car uses gas to drive, that doesn't mean it understands gas" but you are forgetting that the car built itself, piece by piece, by being shown gas over and over and that's it

@amyhoy @stevesi @emollick I might not be understanding your point correctly- but even if you believe deeply LLMs are stochastic parrots: this is EXACTLY the type of thing you should apply stochastic parrot technology to; language that we do not understand the meaning and shape of

@amyhoy @stevesi @emollick I was responding to the point you made ‚Äì I disagree strongly that producing plausible-looking strings of words is the only thing LLMs "can do" ‚Äì the way they build plausible-looking strings of words is derived from the ability to group tokens by meaning without human intervention https://t.co/Ip8BHgbMWY

@amyhoy @stevesi @emollick GPT-3 is unsupervised machine learning; it does not require labeled data or human raters to learn; OpenAI has ALSO done that, but it is not essential to get the LLMs to generate meaningful-looking results (to be very modest) and create meaningful tokens / groupings

@amyhoy @emollick @stevesi what you are describing is an extremely advanced method for linguistic processing and understanding; the exact type of thing that would help these scientists better understand non-human communication - tokenizing whale song would let you analyze and recite "meaningful" patterns https://t.co/IkAKp90FYn
one of the weirder parts about having a robot assistant in the Discord is he responds when I @ here the channel https://t.co/j39VwIW2iH

Making the trailer for your movie should be a crucial step. It should be a prequel, or a single scene, or something intriguing. I think.
Why has making good movie trailers been completely thrown out the window for synopsis-esque spoilertastic greatest hits trailers?
Stacked a bunch of firewood for grandma. Encountered worms, deceased squirrels, and a variety of bugs & crawlies.
Oh. And I redesigned ejfox.com so scope that out if you feel so inclined.
I fancy a sleep.
Oh my god. This Phish song has been playing for 10 minutes and I just didn't notice at all...
The moral of this story is that I'm going to jam around for a while and then maybe take a nap.
I've started using the term 'jam' to describe long durations of miscellaneous pleasurable activity, ie hanging out + listening to music.
Since Cassie's in New York now, can I audition for Series 3? >.>
Is there going to be a Skins soundtrack? I'd like to listen to every Skins song ever, to be honest.
Finally. A week (roughly) later. I am home. God it feels good. I think I'm sick too. At least I'm sick at home though, yeh?
